The start of the 2019 legislative session is here — and we’re ready to work!

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Today marks the kick-off of the 2019 legislative session. With Governor Brad Little stepping into his newly elected role, many new state agency leaders, and significant changes to the make-up of the Idaho Legislature, we at the ACLU of Idaho are even more committed to ensuring that our elected officials and policy makers defend and protect civil liberties for all in Idaho.

With the start of a new session comes an updated list of legislative priorities we will be tackling at the Idaho Statehouse. From ensuring formerly incarcerated Idahoans can access meaningful employment opportunities, to protecting access to housing, and ensuring queer and transgender Idahoans are free from discrimination. We have a busy agenda of civil rights initiatives we’re ready to advance! We invite you to learn more about our top legislative priorities and how you can get involved in policy making in Idaho.

Even though the 2019 session just kicked off today, we invite you to mark your calendars and join us and our LGBTQ allies for a series of upcoming events aimed at reminding lawmakers that they must update Idaho’s Human Rights Act to ensure everyone in our state is free from discrimination in employment, housing and public accommodations.

Flood the Capitol
Wednesday, January 16
11:30 a.m. – 1:30 p.m.
Idaho Statehouse, 700 W. Jefferson St., Boise, ID 83702

Add The Words Lobby Day Training
Sunday, January 20
2 – 5:30 p.m.
Idaho Statehouse, 700 W. Jefferson St., Boise, ID 83702

Add The Words Lobby Day at the Capitol
Monday, January 21
7:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.
Idaho Statehouse, 700 W. Jefferson St., Boise, ID 83702

As always, we invite you to check out our online legislative resources, like our Lobbying 101 Toolkit and weekly bill tracking updates to monitor the work of the Idaho Legislature. And don’t forget to follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for updates on all the inside statehouse happenings including upcoming events, when and where to take action, and how to best connect with lawmakers.

We’re ready and committed to defend civil liberties at the Statehouse once again!

In solidarity,

Kathy Griesmyer
Policy Director, ACLU of Idaho
